column3: Can one of the admins verify this patch?\n
@gmaxwell Can you split this into two commits?\n
Isn't this backward? This sorts by increasing last block time, and erases the last items.\n
Erasing protects them from being evicted, thus keeping the most recent sources.\n
Can be attacked by sending the same block repeatedly.\n
Fixed. (@sipa is this what you suggested?)\n
Please add a comment here explaining why there is a fail through.\n

Actually, I think an attacker can manipulate this metric without performing useful work. It's quite trivial to for a node to send blocks invs to all its connected nodes as soon as it sees a block inv for a new block, and this can mean that many nodes see the block inv from this "cheating" node first since it didn't even need to start downloading the block before it was able to do this. Nodes try t
